1: <sup>1</sup> Not unto us, O LORD, not unto us, but unto thy name give glory, for thy mercy, and for thy truth’s sake.
2: <sup>2</sup> Wherefore should the heathen say, Where is now their God?
3: <sup>3</sup> But our God is in the heavens: he hath done whatsoever he hath pleased.
4: <sup>4</sup> Their idols are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.
5: <sup>5</sup> They have mouths, but they speak not: eyes have they, but they see not:
6: <sup>6</sup> They have ears, but they hear not: noses have they, but they smell not:
7: <sup>7</sup> They have hands, but they handle not: feet have they, but they walk not: neither speak they through their throat.
8: <sup>8</sup> They that make them are like unto them; so is every one that trusteth in them.
9: <sup>9</sup> O Israel, trust thou in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.
10: <sup>10</sup> O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.
11: <sup>11</sup> Ye that fear the LORD, trust in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.
12: <sup>12</sup> The LORD hath been mindful of us: he will bless us; he will bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron.
13: <sup>13</sup> He will bless them that fear the LORD, both small and great.
14: <sup>14</sup> The LORD shall increase you more and more, you and your children.
15: <sup>15</sup> Ye are blessed of the LORD which made heaven and earth.
16: <sup>16</sup> The heaven, even the heavens, are the LORD’s: but the earth hath he given to the children of men.
17: <sup>17</sup> The dead praise not the LORD, neither any that go down into silence.
18: <sup>18</sup> But we will bless the LORD from this time forth and for evermore. Praise the LORD.
